title: RioBlemz
author: RioBlemz
content: Bola A Tinubu is the Chairman of Ecowas and Nigeria President. He said he attended Chicago State University completing a two year program. He claimed he graduated from CSU in 1979.   Nigerians are saying he did not go to any university and he cannot be their president.When approach  to validate this man claim and share his academic record the university took a defensive stance, they countered that the provision of such details is irrelevant especially in the context of a foreign country's electoral matters. Such a stance raises questions about the transparency and veracity of the individual's claims.His opponent in the last election is demanding the statement of his result from Chicago State University and has approach the district of Illinois court. The reluctance of Chicago State University to provide any tangible records or evidence of their student raises eyebrows. It instigates deeper queries regarding the identity of the individual who claims to be Bola A Tinubu and his actual academic history.Bola A Tinubu presented two different result from CSU claiming that the staff of the school made mistake in the graduation date, signatory and logo. Why will a state university issue two different results at different times? Search for clarity continues as this situation serves as a stark reminder of transparency and due diligence in all matters especially those involving identities.Has CSU Stands firm for truth and clarity?Note: The year book for 1979 graduates from Chicago State University has vanished from their site.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: RioBlemz on September 04, 2023, 07:26:45 PMBola A Tinubu is the Chairman of Ecowas and Nigeria President. He said he attended Chicago State University completing a two year program. He claimed he graduated from CSU in 1979.   Nigerians are saying he did not go to any university and he cannot be their president.Your claim that Nigerians don't want Tinubu because he didn't go to the university is not true because the minimum academic qualification for a president in Nigeria is a First School Leaving Certificate and he has the Senior Secondary School Certificate which is higher than the minimum qualification. Nigerians are not happy with the President because the election was rigged and he has many skeletons in his cupboard. There concerns about his state of origin, age, school certificates, drug cases, abetting murder, etc. Nobody knows his parents and nobody knows him in school. And he claims that all of his classmates are dead which is impossible in Nigeria. Even former president Buhari who is 80 years has classmates and Tinubu who is just 71 is saying he has no classmates. He is either lying about his age or he didn't go to school.QuoteThe reluctance of Chicago State University to provide any tangible records or evidence of their student raises eyebrows. It instigates deeper queries regarding the identity of the individual who claims to be Bola A Tinubu and his actual academic history.Bola A Tinubu presented two different result from CSU claiming that the staff of the school made mistake in the graduation date, signatory and logo. Why will a state university issue two different results at different times? Several Nigerians have approached the Chicago State University to confirm if the President truly graduated from the University and they have also affirmed that he was their student and graduated with honors. It is only the university that can confirm that he was their student and they have confirmed. You have to accept the fact and move on until it is proven otherwise. Cases like this can be used by powerful nations to control developing nations. There is speculation that those results were fake but a powerful nation wants to use this opportunity to protect him and gain his loyalty. This news is baseless because they are mere rumors and speculations without facts.

comments.body: The issue and challenge with Tinubu is that everything about him is shrouded in secrecy, from his education to his livelihood. He doesn't have his records straight and that is why Nigerians don't believe him to be the better choice. We all know that the election was rigged and they know that the constitution allows for swearing in despite adjudication and now they have used the judiciary to get judgement for themselves. The Nigerian constitution need to be amended not to allow for swearing in new government until whatever legal adjudication on the election was through.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Why are we still talking about this by this time. Bola A. Tinubu is now the president of Nigeria and the Chairman of ECOWAS. What more credibility are you haunting for? I feel like it's unnecessary. Nigeria is historically one of the African countries with the earliest and most formidable democracies in the world. Like an institution, Nigeria has constitutions and code of conducts that guides it's political and institutional processes amongst others. If the president was able to pass through the electoral process with the simple majority and inaugurated by the Chief Judge of the Federation, I think that's enough of credibility to work with.According to the Chapter VI, Part I, Section 131 of the Nigerian Constitution, a person is qualified for election to the position of president if:1. They are a citizen of Nigeria by birth;2. They have attained the age of 35 years (40 before 2018);3. They are a member of a political party and are sponsored by that political party;4. They have been educated up to at least School Certificate level or its equivalent. This School Certificate level includes the first school leaving certificate which is otherwise known as the High School, in the USA system. If that's the case, whether or not the president had a Chicago University is not pressing and not a prerequisite for becoming the president of Nigeria..Similarly, the standing requirement of the ECOWAS to be it's Chairman is to be a sitting/incumbent President of any of the West African countries. So, in a nutshell, I feel like it's unnecessary and non-topical to discuss the subject matter today and here.

comments.author: Macoach
comments.body: I prefer not to take sides, but there are concerns about Tinubu's questionable history, marked by unverified claims and lack of evidence. It appears to be a potential scam, although the university asserts his credibility based on their word alone. In the realm of politics, corruption is unfortunately a recurring issue.
